messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Kaneyama? tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: The texture of the plate, the thickness, sukashi design, treatment of the seppa dai and shape of the kozuka ana remind me of some katchushi work.  The basket
messages.messageBody:
The texture of the plate, the thickness, sukashi design, treatment of the seppa dai and shape of the kozuka ana remind me of some katchushi work. The basket weave carving pushes me in the direction of Shoami. I agree with Alan on probably Ko-Shoami.

Jim



Guys:

Thanks for all the input!
Here is a better photo:
http://www.nihontophile.com/KotoTsu.jpg
Measurements:
74mm wide by 76mm tall
3mm thick

Thanks again,
Ron


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

flush it out.

Rich

Alan

messages.subject: Kaneyama? tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: All: I was wondering about the attribution of this tsuba: http://www.nihontophile.com/Kaneyama.jpg Tsuba plate has a deep black (not purple) patina. Pics don t
messages.messageBody:
All:

I was wondering about the attribution of this tsuba:
http://www.nihontophile.com/Kaneyama.jpg
Tsuba plate has a deep black (not purple) patina. Pics don't really
convey this but I think early.
Looking at the center of the tsuba and the hitsui ana I thought
Kaneyama. Looking at the outer portion of the plate (with the basket
weave), I don't know.
No prominent bones on the rim.
Pretty tsuba once I got off the gold paint that someone had decided
to coat it with.......

Thanks for looking,
Ron
